fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • Based on information provided to the Guardian, an article said the great fox-spider had not been seen in the UK since 1993 on Hankley Common, Surrey (Endangered spider spotted in Britain for first time in 27 years, 31 October, page 25). But the British Arachnological Society gives the last sighting as 1999 on Morden Bog, Dorset. Also, Nick Baker is a patron of the society, not its president. • The clue for S in Saturday’s prize cryptic crossword failed to state that it required a 10-letter answer (No 28,285, 7 November, page 12, Journal). • Other recently amended articles include: UK’s coronavirus vaccine taskforce chief faces questions over biotech fund Travel to UK from Denmark banned amid worries over Covid in mink ‘It’s not over’: Trump supporters protest Biden victory in swing states With empathy and humility, Biden sets out to make America sane again Joe Biden begins transition as Trump plays golf and refuses to concede – US election live Police attend Zizzi restaurant in Bristol over alleged Covid test breach ‘A backlash against a patriarchal culture’: How Polish protests go beyond abortion rights ‘Super rare’ 100-year-old carrier pigeon message found in France
